did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Letters from famous American and foreign statesmen, authors, and scholars, relating to their evaluation of the historical significance of Woodrow Wilson, President of the U.S., 1913-1921.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

did.unittitle: Biographical information on Paul A. Hill, 1896-1969

Letters from world famous people: George Bernard Shaw, Sigmund Freud, Carl Jung, Edward Benes, W. E. B. du Bois, Sir Wilfred Grenfell, Stephen Leacock, H. L. Mencken, Scott Nearing, V. F. Orlando, J. Paul Concour, Romain Rolland, George Santayana, Norman Thomas, and many others
Letters from foreign diplomats and statesmen, delegates to the Paris Peace Conference, etc.
Letters from educators: college presidents, professors in United States universities
Letters from religious leaders: ministers, theological professors
Letters from authors: Gertrude Atherton, Katherine Bates, Edgar Lee Masters, etc.
Letters from politicians in the United States, members of Congress, Senators, etc.
Correspondence concerning the North Atlantic Pact and sundry subjects
